place_of_publication.publication_title: in N. L. Britton et al., N. Amer. Fl.

treatment.description: Stems usually decumbent-ascending, 1.5–13 dm, minutely puberulent, glabrate, or glabrous basally. Leaf blades green, linear-lanceolate to lanceolate, 3–11 × 0.4–1.4(–1.8) cm, surfaces glabrous or glabrate. Inflorescences narrowly to widely forked, usually without main axis; fruiting involucres 4–6 mm, crosswalls of peduncle hairs usually dark. Perianth pink to deep purple-pink.
treatment.habitat: open gravelly or sandy areas in brush, pine, or mixed conifer forests
treatment.discussion: Mirabilis linearis var. decipiens probably represents populations intergradient between var. linearis and Mirabilis melanotricha.
